hook.text: A product team debated a feature name for three meetings. Meanwhile, the competitor shipped.

buildup.text: Parkinson's law applies to decisions: they expand to fill the time you give them.

discovery.text: Time-boxing forces a deadline: we will decide by 3pm today, with whatever we know then.

twist.text: Artificial urgency isn't reckless. It's a tool against perfectionism and analysis paralysis.

climax.text: Set the timer. Make the call. Course-correct next week if needed.

punchline.text: A decision has a shelf life. Don't let it expire.

quiz.question: What does time-boxing a decision accomplish?
options: Forces a deadline to prevent analysis paralysis
Guarantees the best possible outcome every time
Removes the need for any follow-up review
